page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: combine to give a longer growing season for the grass than in many parts of the country.Somerset is of course noted for its Cheddar cheese.. a product from surplus milk production and the area is therefore part of a major Dairying region. Another famous farm product of the region is Cider.Fruit production is a second speciality of the area and apple orchards are found near Staplehay at Spearcey Farm,and again at Little Poundisford Farm for example.It is quite common for these apple orchards to be planted and maintained for the first five years by Taunton Cider,a nationally known firm based at Norton Fitzwarren.Many farms within a catchment area of these works produce fruit which is sent in September to the Norton Fitzwarren works.There it is stored in what is
